Package villagertalk.villagertalk.VillagerChatUI

Klasse ExtendedMerchantScreen

java.lang.Object
net.minecraft.client.gui.AbstractParentElement
net.minecraft.client.gui.screen.Screen
net.minecraft.client.gui.screen.ingame.HandledScreen<net.minecraft.screen.MerchantScreenHandler>
villagertalk.villagertalk.VillagerChatUI.ExtendedMerchantScreen
Alle implementierten Schnittstellen:
net.minecraft.client.gui.Drawable, net.minecraft.client.gui.Element, net.minecraft.client.gui.navigation.Navigable, net.minecraft.client.gui.ParentElement, net.minecraft.client.gui.screen.ingame.ScreenHandlerProvider<net.minecraft.screen.MerchantScreenHandler>
@Environment(CLIENT) public class ExtendedMerchantScreen extends net.minecraft.client.gui.screen.ingame.HandledScreen<net.minecraft.screen.MerchantScreenHandler>
ExtendedMerchantScreen extends the MerchantScreen with additional features for villager interaction. This class is responsible for handling the UI elements and interactions for the villager trading screen. It includes additional UI elements for the chat box and text field for player input.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • ExtendedMerchantScreen

      public ExtendedMerchantScreen(net.minecraft.screen.MerchantScreenHandler handler, net.minecraft.entity.player.PlayerInventory inventory, net.minecraft.text.Text title)
      Constructs a new ExtendedMerchantScreen instance, extending the MerchantScreen with additional features for villager interaction.
      Parameter:
      handler - The MerchantScreenHandler instance to handle screen interactions. Must not be null.
      inventory - The PlayerInventory instance representing the player's inventory. Must not be null.
      title - The Text instance representing the screen title. Must not be null. This constructor initializes the ExtendedMerchantScreen with additional UI elements and settings:
      • Initializes a TextFieldWidget for user input, positioned at (50, 325), with a placeholder text "Click to talk with villager" and a maximum length of 256 characters.
      • Initializes a VillagerTalkScrollableChatWidget for displaying chat messages, positioned at (50, 50) with dimensions 256x256, and sets its initial message to "Thinking about initial Message...".
      • Calls requestInitialMessageFromServer() to request the initial chat message from the server.
      Additionally, sets the current instance of ExtendedMerchantScreen to this instance.

    • keyPressed

      public boolean keyPressed(int keyCode, int scanCode, int modifiers)
      Overridden method to handle key presses Handles the ESC key press to close the screen Handles the 'E' key press to prevent exiting the window when typing Handles the 'Enter' key press to send the player message Handles the 'Enter' key press to set the text field to focused
      Angegeben von:
      keyPressed in Schnittstelle net.minecraft.client.gui.Element
      Angegeben von:
      keyPressed in Schnittstelle net.minecraft.client.gui.ParentElement
      Setzt außer Kraft:
      keyPressed in Klasse net.minecraft.client.gui.screen.ingame.HandledScreen<net.minecraft.screen.MerchantScreenHandler>
      Parameter:
      keyCode - the key code of the key pressed
      scanCode - the scan code of the key pressed
      modifiers - the modifiers of the key pressed
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the key press was handled locally, otherwise return the super method

    • onPlayerMessageSent

      private void onPlayerMessageSent(String message)
      Called when the player sends a message sets the writingField to not focused, clears the writingField, sets the writingField to not editable, adds the message to the chat box
      Parameter:
      message - the message sent by the player

    • sendPlayerMessage

      private void sendPlayerMessage()
      Sends a player message gets the message from the writingField and calls onPlayerMessageSent(String) with the message then calls sendPlayerPromptPacket(String) with the message.
